Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a sharp low-placed carination, a wide sloping shoulder, a short blunt upthrust nozzle, and a small plain discus with a raised flat rim. On the rear shoulder is a ribbed lug-handle. The wide flat base bears a Greek inscription, presumably referring to the city of Sagalassos. Covered with a patchy orange to brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2086.bis)
